sample_collector_contact_email.description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sample.

depth_of_coverage_value.description: The average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.

breadth_of_coverage_value.description: The percentage of the reference genome covered by the sequenced data, to a prescribed depth.

most_recent_travel_departure_date.description: The date of a person's most recent departure from their primary residence (at that time) on a journey to one or more other locations.

sequencing_protocol.description: The protocol used to generate the sequence.
examples: Genomes were generated through amplicon sequencing of 1200 bp amplicons with Freed schema primers. Libraries were created using Illumina DNA Prep kits, and sequence data was produced using Miseq Micro v2 (500 cycles) sequencing kits.

host_age_bin.description: The age category of the host at the time of sampling.

anatomical_material.description: A substance obtained from an anatomical part of an organism e.g. tissue, blood.

sample_collection_date.description: The date on which the sample was collected.

diagnostic_pcr_ct_value_2.description: The cycle threshold (CT) value result from a diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.

number_of_vaccine_doses_received.description: The number of doses of the vaccine recived by the host.

lab_host.description: Name and description of the laboratory host used to propagate the source organism or material from which the sample was obtained.

anatomical_part.description: An anatomical part of an organism e.g. oropharynx.

sequencing_date.description: The date the sample was sequenced.

ns_per_100_kbp.description: The number of N symbols present in the consensus fasta sequence, per 100kbp of sequence.

biosample_accession.description: The identifier assigned to a BioSample in INSDC archives.

last_dose_vacicnation_date.description: The date the host received their last dose of vaccine.

bioinformatics_protocol.description: The name and version number of the bioinformatics protocol used.

prior_sars_cov_2_antiviral_treatment.description: Whether there was prior SARS-CoV-2 treatment with an antiviral agent.

gene_name_2.description: The name of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.

body_product.description: A substance excreted/secreted from an organism e.g. feces, urine, sweat.

host_age.description: Age of host at the time of sampling.

host_ethnicity.description: The self-identified ethnicity(ies) of the host.

geo_loc_name_country.description: Country of origin of the sample.

collection_device.description: The instrument or container used to collect the sample e.g. swab.

purpose_of_sequencing.description: The reason that the sample was sequenced.

raw_sequence_data_processing_method.description: The method used for raw data processing such as removing barcodes, adapter trimming, filtering etc.

sequence_submitter_contact_address.description: The mailing address of the agency submitting the sequence.
examples: 123 Sunnybrooke St, Toronto, Ontario, M4P 1L6, Canada

specimen_processing.description: Any processing applied to the sample during or after receiving the sample.

bioproject_umbrella_accession.description: The INSDC umbrella accession number of the BioProject to which the BioSample belongs.

flow_cell_barcode.description: The barcode of the flow cell used for sequencing.

r1_fastq_filename.description: The user-specified filename of the r1 FASTQ file.

destination_of_most_recent_travel_city.description: The name of the city that was the destination of most recent travel.

r1_fastq_filepath.description: The filepath of the r1 FASTQ file.

library_id.description: The user-specified identifier for the library prepared for sequencing.

host_vaccination_status.description: The vaccination status of the host (fully vaccinated, partially vaccinated, or not vaccinated).

geo_loc_longitude.description: The longitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.

genbank_ena_ddbj_accession.description: The GenBank/ENA/DDBJ identifier assigned to the sequence in the INSDC archives.

bioproject_accession.description: The INSDC accession number of the BioProject(s) to which the BioSample belongs.

lineage_clade_analysis_software_name.description: The name of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.

location_of_exposure_geo_loc_name_countr.description: The country where the host was likely exposed to the causative agent of the illness.

sample_plan_name.description: The name of the sample plan implemented for sample collection.

prior_sars_cov_2_antiviral_treatment_dat.description: The date treatment was first administered during the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.

library_preparation_kit.description: The name of the DNA library preparation kit used to generate the library being sequenced.

fast5_filename.description: The user-specified filename of the FAST5 file.

diagnostic_pcr_ct_value_1.description: The Ct value result from a diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.

collection_method.description: The process used to collect the sample e.g. phlebotomy, necropsy.

geo_loc_name_county_region.description: The county/region of origin of the sample.

consensus_genome_length.description: Size of the assembled genome described as the number of base pairs.

r2_fastq_filepath.description: The filepath of the r2 FASTQ file.

sample_received_date.description: The date on which the sample was received.

host_common_name.description: The commonly used name of the host.

geo_loc_name_state_province_territory.description: The state/province/territory of origin of the sample.

lineage_clade_analysis_software_version.description: The version of the software used to determine the lineage/clade.

host_subject_id.description: A unique identifier by which each host can be referred to e.g. #131

sra_accession.description: The Sequence Read Archive (SRA), European Nucleotide Archive (ENA) or DDBJ Sequence Read Archive (DRA) identifier linking raw read data, methodological metadata and quality control metrics submitted to the INSDC.

authors.description: Names of individuals contributing to the processes of sample collection, sequence generation, analysis, and data submission.
examples: Tejinder Singh, Fei Hu, Johnny Blogs

host_role.description: The role of the host in relation to the exposure setting.

consensus_sequence_name.description: The name of the consensus sequence.

gisaid_accession.description: The GISAID accession number assigned to the sequence.

destination_of_most_recent_travel__state.description: The name of the province that was the destination of most recent travel.

consensus_sequence_filepath.description: The filepath of the consesnsus sequence file.

number_of_base_pairs_sequenced.description: The number of total base pairs generated by the sequencing process.

destination_of_most_recent_travel_countr.description: The name of the country that was the destination of most recent travel.

fast5_filepath.description: The filepath of the FAST5 file.

culture_collection.description: The name of the source collection and unique culture identifier.

amplicon_size.description: The length of the amplicon generated by PCR amplification.

sample_collector_contact_address.description: The mailing address of the agency submitting the sample.
examples: 655 Lab St, Vancouver, British Columbia, V5N 2A2, Canada

collection_protocol.description: The name and version of a particular protocol used for sampling.

variant_evidence.description: The evidence used to make the variant determination.
examples: lineage-defining mutations: ORF1ab (K1655N), Spike (K417N, E484K, N501Y, D614G, A701V), N (T205I), E (P71L)

most_recent_travel_return_date.description: The date of a person's most recent return to some residence from a journey originating at that residence.

prior_sars_cov_2_infection.description: Whether there was prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.

gisaid_virus_name.description: The user-defined GISAID virus name assigned to the sequence.

specimen_collector_sample_id.description: The user-defined name for the sample.

host_scientific_name.description: The taxonomic, or scientific name of the host.

host_disease.description: The name of the disease experienced by the host.

passage_method.description: Description of how organism was passaged.

symptom_onset_date.description: The date on which the symptoms began or were first noted.

r2_fastq_filename.description: The user-specified filename of the r2 FASTQ file.

prior_sars_cov_2_infection_date.description: The date of diagnosis of the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.

purpose_of_sampling_details.description: Further details pertaining to the reason the sample was collected.
examples: Screening of bat specimens in museum collections.

host_gender.description: The gender of the host at the time of sample collection.

prior_sars_cov_2_antiviral_treatment_age.description: The name of the antiviral treatment agent administered during the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.

diagnostic_pcr_protocol_2.description: The name and version number of the protocol used for diagnostic marker amplification.

diagnostic_pcr_protocol_1.description: The name and version number of the protocol used for diagnostic marker amplification.

lineage_clade_name.description: The name of the lineage or clade.

gene_name_1.description: The name of the gene used in the diagnostic RT-PCR test.

consensus_sequence_software_name.description: The name of software used to generate the consensus sequence.

reference_genome_accession.description: A persistent, unique identifier of a genome database entry.

host_residence_geo_loc_name_country.description: The country where the host resides.

travel_history.description: Travel history in last six months.
examples: Canada, Vancouver, USA, Seattle, Italy, Milan

consensus_sequence_software_version.description: The version of the software used to generate the consensus sequence.

complications.description: Patient medical complications that are believed to have occurred as a result of host disease.

geo_loc_name_city.description: The city of origin of the sample.

consensus_sequence_filename.description: The name of the consensus sequence file.

biomaterial_extracted.description: The biomaterial extracted from samples for the purpose of sequencing.

host_age_unit.description: The units used to measure the host's age.

geo_loc_latitude.description: The latitude coordinates of the geographical location of sample collection.

environmental_material.description: A substance obtained from the natural or man-made environment e.g. soil, water, sewage, door handle, bed handrail, face mask.

sequence_submitter_contact_email.description: The email address of the contact responsible for follow-up regarding the sequence.

environmental_site.description: An environmental location may describe a site in the natural or built environment e.g. hospital, wet market, bat cave.

pre_existing_conditions_and_risk_factors.description: Patient pre-existing conditions and risk factors.

first_dose_vaccination_date.description: The date the host was first vaccinated.

variant_designation.description: The variant classification of the lineage/clade i.e. variant, variant of concern.

sample_collected_in_quarantine.description: Whether the sample was collected from an individual in quarantine.

sample_collected_by.description: The name of the agency that collected the original sample.
examples: Public Health Agency of Canada, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

sequencing_instrument.description: The model of the sequencing instrument used.

host_health_status_details.description: Further details pertaining to the health or disease status of the host at time of collection.

geo_loc_name_state_province_region.description: State/province/region of origin of the sample.

host_health_state.description: Health status of the host at the time of sample collection.

signs_and_symptoms.description: A perceived change in function or sensation, (loss, disturbance or appearance) indicative of a disease, reported by a patient.

dehosting_method.description: The method used to remove host reads from the pathogen sequence.

amplicon_pcr_primer_scheme.description: The specifications of the primers (primer sequences, binding positions, fragment size generated etc) used to generate the amplicons to be sequenced.

data_abstraction_details.description: A description of how any data elements were altered to preserve patient privacy.

depth_of_coverage_threshold.description: The threshold used as a cut-off for the depth of coverage.

purpose_of_sequencing_details.description: The description of why the sample was sequenced providing specific details.
examples: Screened for S gene target failure (S dropout)

sequence_submitted_by.description: The name of the agency that generated the sequence.
examples: Public Health Agency of Canada, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

sequencing_protocol_name.description: The name and version number of the sequencing protocol used.

prior_sars_cov_2_infection_isolate.description: The identifier of the isolate found in the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection.

purpose_of_sampling.description: The reason that the sample was collected.
